workflow.name: Track Google Trends search data locally with Bright Data MCP & AI analysis
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

This workflow automatically tracks local search trends and geographic-specific search patterns to optimize local SEO and marketing strategies. It saves you time by eliminating the need to manually research local search behavior and provides location-based insights for targeted marketing campaigns.

## Overview

This workflow automatically scrapes local search results, geographic search trends, and location-based query data to understand regional search behavior and local market opportunities. It uses Bright Data to access location-specific search data and AI to intelligently analyze local trends and optimization opportunities.

## Tools Used

- **n8n**: The automation platform that orchestrates the workflow
- **Bright Data**: For scraping location-based search data without being blocked
- **OpenAI**: AI agent for intelligent local search trend analysis
- **Google Sheets**: For storing local search trend data and geographic insights

## How to Install

1. **Import the Workflow**: Download the .json file and import it into your n8n instance
2. **Configure Bright Data**: Add your Bright Data credentials to the MCP Client node
3. **Set Up OpenAI**: Configure your OpenAI API credentials
4. **Configure Google Sheets**: Connect your Google Sheets account and set up your local trends tracking spreadsheet
5. **Customize**: Define target locations and local search monitoring parameters

## Use Cases

- **Local SEO**: Optimize for location-specific search queries and trends
- **Regional Marketing**: Tailor campaigns to local search behavior and preferences
- **Multi-location Businesses**: Track search trends across different geographic markets
- **Market Expansion**: Identify new geographic opportunities based on search trends

## Connect with Me

- **Website**: https://www.nofluff.online
- **YouTube**: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
- **LinkedIn**: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
- **Get Bright Data**: https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25 (Using this link supports my free workflows with a small commission)

#n8n #automation #localsearch #localseo #searchtrends #brightdata #webscraping #geographictrends #n8nworkflow #workflow #nocode #localmarketing #regionalseo #locationbased #localbusiness #searchgeography #localtrends #geoseo #localdata #regionalmarketing #localanalytics #geographicseo #localsearchdata #localoptimization #regionalsearch #locationmarketing #localsearchtrends #geomarketing #localinsights #regionalsearch

parameters.text:
=Use Bright Data MCP to scrape the following Google Trends URL and return with keywords, score, and date.

URL: {{ $json.url }}

parameters.content:
### ## üü¢ **SECTION 1 ‚Äî üöÄ Trigger & Input: ‚ÄúSet the Mission‚Äù**

**‚ú® Nodes in this section:**
1Ô∏è‚É£ **üîå Trigger: Manual Start**
2Ô∏è‚É£ **üìù Set Region & Topic**

---

### üéØ **What happens here?**

* **Purpose:**
  This section is your *starting point*. It lets *you* (or anyone using this workflow) **decide when to run** it and **what you want to search for**.

* **How it works:**

  * The **üîå Trigger** node is like a *button*. When you click *Execute Workflow*, the whole process starts.
  * The **üìù Input Fields** node lets you fill in details ‚Äî for example:

    * *Region:* ‚ÄúLos Angeles‚Äù
    * *Topic:* ‚ÄúRestaurants‚Äù, ‚ÄúConcerts‚Äù, ‚ÄúEvents near me‚Äù
  * These inputs tell the Agent exactly **which local trends** to scrape.

* **Benefit for beginners:**
  You don‚Äôt need to open Google Trends manually or copy-paste URLs ‚Äî just **set your target location & topic once**, click a button, and you‚Äôre good to go! üåç‚ú®

---

---

### ## üü° **SECTION 2 ‚Äî ü§ñ Scrape Trends with Bright Data MCP**

**‚ú® Nodes in this section:**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **ü§ñ Scrape Trends with MCP**

* Sub-nodes:

  * üß† **OpenAI Model** ‚Üí Handles the Agent‚Äôs logic & instructions
  * üåê **Bright Data MCP** ‚Üí Runs the actual scraping
  * üóÇÔ∏è **Structured Output Parser** ‚Üí Makes sure the data comes back clean JSON

---

### üéØ **What happens here?**

* **Purpose:**
  This section is the *smart engine* of your workflow. It sends your search request out to the internet, collects the latest **local trending keywords**, and puts them in a neat, structured format.

* **How it works:**

  * The **ü§ñ Agent** takes your region & topic and talks to **Bright Data MCP** ‚Äî your web scraper.
  * Bright Data crawls **Google Trends** (or another site) and finds **hot keywords**, **interest scores**, and **when they started trending**.
  * The **Structured Output Parser** makes sure the raw text is turned into tidy, machine-readable **JSON** ‚Äî so you don‚Äôt need to clean up messy data yourself.

* **Benefit for beginners:**
  You don‚Äôt have to write scraping code or build a custom parser. The Agent + Bright Data MCP do it all. It‚Äôs like having a digital research assistant that never sleeps. üßë‚Äçüíªüîç

---

---

### ## üü£ **SECTION 3 ‚Äî üß© Process & Save: ‚ÄúPut it to Work‚Äù**

**‚ú® Nodes in this section:**
4Ô∏è‚É£ **üß© Split Trends (One per Item)**
5Ô∏è‚É£ **üìÑ Save to Google Sheets**

---

### üéØ **What happens here?**

* **Purpose:**
  This section *unpacks* the scraped data and *uses* it ‚Äî by saving it to your Google Sheet, ready for SEO or marketing.

* **How it works:**

  * The **üß© Code** node (your `Function`) takes the full list of keywords and **breaks them into single items** ‚Äî one keyword per row.
  * The **üìÑ Google Sheets** node then **appends** each keyword as a new row:

    * Keyword
    * Search volume
    * When it started trending

## I‚Äôll receive a tiny commission if you join Bright Data through this link‚Äîthanks for fueling more free content!

### https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25

            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE

## üéØ **üìç Title:**

**‚ÄúLocal Trends Scraper & SEO Booster ‚Äî Automated Google Trends to Sheets Workflow‚Äù**

### ## üü¢ **SECTION 1 ‚Äî üöÄ Trigger & Input: ‚ÄúSet the Mission‚Äù**

### üéØ **What happens here?**

* **Purpose:**
  This section is your *starting point*. It lets *you* (or anyone using this workflow) **decide when to run** it and **what you want to search for**.

* **How it works:**

  * The **üîå Trigger** node is like a *button*. When you click *Execute Workflow*, the whole process starts.
  * The **üìù Input Fields** node lets you fill in details ‚Äî for example:

    * *Region:* ‚ÄúLos Angeles‚Äù
    * *Topic:* ‚ÄúRestaurants‚Äù, ‚ÄúConcerts‚Äù, ‚ÄúEvents near me‚Äù
  * These inputs tell the Agent exactly **which local trends** to scrape.

* **Benefit for beginners:**
  You don‚Äôt need to open Google Trends manually or copy-paste URLs ‚Äî just **set your target location & topic once**, click a button, and you‚Äôre good to go! üåç‚ú®

### ## üü° **SECTION 2 ‚Äî ü§ñ Scrape Trends with Bright Data MCP**

**‚ú® Nodes in this section:**
3Ô∏è‚É£ **ü§ñ Scrape Trends with MCP**

* Sub-nodes:

  * üß† **OpenAI Model** ‚Üí Handles the Agent‚Äôs logic & instructions
  * üåê **Bright Data MCP** ‚Üí Runs the actual scraping
  * üóÇÔ∏è **Structured Output Parser** ‚Üí Makes sure the data comes back clean JSON

---

### üéØ **What happens here?**

* **Purpose:**
  This section is the *smart engine* of your workflow. It sends your search request out to the internet, collects the latest **local trending keywords**, and puts them in a neat, structured format.

* **How it works:**

  * The **ü§ñ Agent** takes your region & topic and talks to **Bright Data MCP** ‚Äî your web scraper.
  * Bright Data crawls **Google Trends** (or another site) and finds **hot keywords**, **interest scores**, and **when they started trending**.
  * The **Structured Output Parser** makes sure the raw text is turned into tidy, machine-readable **JSON** ‚Äî so you don‚Äôt need to clean up messy data yourself.

* **Benefit for beginners:**
  You don‚Äôt have to write scraping code or build a custom parser. The Agent + Bright Data MCP do it all. It‚Äôs like having a digital research assistant that never sleeps. üßë‚Äçüíªüîç

---

---

### ## üü£ **SECTION 3 ‚Äî üß© Process & Save: ‚ÄúPut it to Work‚Äù**

**‚ú® Nodes in this section:**
4Ô∏è‚É£ **üß© Split Trends (One per Item)**
5Ô∏è‚É£ **üìÑ Save to Google Sheets**

---

### üéØ **What happens here?**

* **Purpose:**
  This section *unpacks* the scraped data and *uses* it ‚Äî by saving it to your Google Sheet, ready for SEO or marketing.

* **How it works:**

  * The **üß© Code** node (your `Function`) takes the full list of keywords and **breaks them into single items** ‚Äî one keyword per row.
  * The **üìÑ Google Sheets** node then **appends** each keyword as a new row:

    * Keyword
    * Search volume
    * When it started trending

* **Benefit for beginners:**
  You instantly have a **ready-made spreadsheet** you can share with your content team, SEO team, or use to update your local landing pages.
  No manual copy-paste. No formatting headaches. üìä‚úÖ

---

---

## üåü **‚ú® How does this help you win?**

‚úÖ **Fully automated:** You can run it every day or week ‚Äî always get fresh local keywords.
‚úÖ **SEO superpower:** See exactly *what‚Äôs trending* in your region ‚Üí update landing pages ‚Üí get more local traffic.
‚úÖ **No code needed:** All you did was *click*, *input*, *watch it run*.
‚úÖ **Team-ready:** The final Google Sheet is shareable, editable, and easy to integrate with your marketing process.

---

## üéâ **üíé Visual Summary**

```
üìå SECTION 1: üü¢ Trigger & Input  
   üîå Manual Start ‚Üí üìù Set Region & Topic

üìå SECTION 2: üü° Scrape & Structure  
   ü§ñ Agent ‚Üí üß† OpenAI ‚Üí üåê Bright Data ‚Üí üóÇÔ∏è JSON Parser

üìå SECTION 3: üü£ Process & Save  
   üß© Split Keywords ‚Üí üìÑ Save to Google Sheets
```

---

## ‚úÖ **Use Case Example**

> **Example:**
> Local bakery in Los Angeles wants to know trending searches for ‚Äúbest cake shops‚Äù or ‚ÄúIndependence Day treats‚Äù ‚Üí this workflow finds hot search trends ‚Üí your SEO person adds those phrases to landing pages ‚Üí you rank higher locally ‚Üí more customers! üéÇüéÜ

---
